title: Brennan Center survey: local election officials warn of federal support cuts
summary: Brennan Center July 2025 survey of 858 local election officials found 60% concerned about federal cuts to election security services. CISA halted election security work March 2025, fired 130 cybersecurity workers. 61% concerned about CISA service cuts. 87% said state/local governments need to provide additional resources. 46% fear politically motivated investigations, 33% experienced threats/harassment.
notes: Survey conducted mid-April to mid-May, 858 officials, margin of error ±3%. 36% very concerned, 24% somewhat concerned about cuts. 90% of those who heard a lot about cuts were concerned. DOGE task force cut funding for Elections Infrastructure ISAC. Lawrence Norden: federal government has big picture advantage difficult for states to replicate.
